ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: you will certainly see the Blazing Fire!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: You have indeed to behold Hell;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You will surely end up seeing Hell;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Verily, you shall see the blazing Fire!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: You should most certainly have seen the hell;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: you would see the fire of Hell.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: you would have surely seen hell [in this very life].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Verily, You shall see the blazing Fire (Hell)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: that you shall surely see Hell?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: You will surely see the Hellfire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [102:6] you would surely see hell-fire, the Fire (la-tarawunna’l-jahīma: this is the response to an omitted oath; the third consonant of the root of the verb [r-’-y] together with the second have been omitted, and its vowel has been transposed onto the rā’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (For ye will behold hellflre) on the Day of Judgement.
